comment: The adult seminar class is filled with information you will need for any resource on campus. He really opens your eyes to exciting topics based around the textbook. Great experience!
I highly recommend this course. I learned so much about the university and the resources/activities it offers that I wouldn't have known otherwise. Class was fun!

Mr. Powell really helps lay a good foundation for college life. His assignments were to attend a lot of school events. It helped me to know the resources available at KSU. Very laid back. Open book tests but tricky :)

Sexiest teacher I've ever had, hands down.  Tall, dark, and handsome?  You know it.  Oh, and by sexy, I'm talking about I need to loosen my belt a few notches to make room for the tent I just pitched in my pants.
This lady is a horrible teacher. She does nothing more than read from the power points.  Boring. Useless.

I took this class Fall 07.  Her tests were multiple choice. There is a lot of material covered in this class. If you read what your suppose to and study the maps, you'll be ok. GO TO CLASS. She gave 5 extra points on your FINAL GRADE if you had perfect attendance. I'm not sure about the bad reviews here, she was very helpful.
Very nice, He is willing to help you in all matters of your school experience.

YOU MUST STUDY!!  Her tests come straight from the book and they are all multiple choice.  As long as you read the material and study, you will do fine.  Map Quizzes are easy IF YOU STUDY!  She gives small quizzes for extra credit and you can drop your lowest test grade. I would defiantly take her again (just not @ 8am).  :)

I dont recommend taking her class.  Her tests were rediculous.  Not only do you have to know the 3 chapters for the test, but you have to know every country, river, landform, etc. and be able to identify it on a map.   The only good thing was that you have a chance to get 10 bonus points on your final grade.

Sylvia Powell... Nice teacher, but her class is easy to stay awake in @ 8 in the morning. Sometimes the info is interesting. She does powerpoints the whole course, which she posts on WebCT. Points are taken off your final grade for absences. Test easiness varies... You HAVE to study! Halfway thru the semester she gave us general reviews.

Usually I have great things to say about teachers... but Powell is really hard. He gives pop quizzes all of the time that count for 35% of the grade... and the quizzes are nit-picky over things discussed or read... IMPOSSIBLE!! The tests are reallllly hard. Aviod! Avoid!

Her lecturtes can be a tad dry, but go to class, you will gets points added to final grade. She posts all notes on WebCT so you don't get a cramp in your hand trying to keep up on paper. HW is a tad tedious. Lets you drop one of 5 tests, you can drop final and still get an A.  Good professor.

She is a excellent teacher.  All you have to do is go to class and take notes and pay attention and you will do well on the test.  Homework assignments are easy and so are the tests.  Highly recommended.

Good teacher.  Make sure you are there for class because she offers extra credit for attendance.  Also, make sure you are there for the test reviews the day before an exam because she tells you what to read and make sure you do and you will get a good grade in this class.

A lot of work. 6 papers on realms, 4> map quizzes, 5> tests. Don't miss a class she will deduct points from your papers without you even knowing. If you are willing to do the work you will be ok. I almost got an A. If I did well then anybody can heh
There were so many notes I could hardly keep up! If you plan to work REALLY hard to get an A, then do not get her as a teacher.

There's a lot of information for the class, but she goes over it pretty well. Her lectures move really fast, but you can get the notes online to follow along. Lots to learn, but not too hard. Plus final isn't cumulative!
